Recommended game to all JRPG/anime/visual novel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers.

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches, it plays extremely well. In my opinion, this is a great and fun game, although the format can be somewhat irritating, with the free-roam city area repopulating with new enemies every time you progress the story. I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments where you can play as Batman and another character. The ability to use the controller for most parts of the game, but switch to mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments, was greatly appreciated. Driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, especially when chasing the APC commanders, is quite enjoyable once you master skidding around corners. When you master that, driving around the city becomes a real pleasure!

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: An excellent AAA FPS shooter—that’s the bottom line. It looks, sounds, and plays superbly with outstanding FPS mechanics, an engaging story, cool characters, impeccable voice acting, and a fantastic soundtrack. However, it’s not for the faint-hearted—some cutscenes are quite intense. But when a game is so great overall, its flaws become more apparent, and here are the ones I noticed: - No SLI support—I had to shelve the game until I upgraded my card, as it ran poorly on my old dual GPU GTX 590. Ensure you have a fairly decent single GPU card. - Frustratingly small obstacles are often unclimbable.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished: English is not my native language. I am Dutch, so please excuse any typing or grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review into a few categories: graphics, controls, sound, gameplay, and replayability. Graphics: The game is set in a comic-like style, with slick visuals and no unnecessary details. The color schemes are nice and effective for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 Pentium processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710m card and 8GB memory, and it operates smoothly on Windows 8.1. Controls: The game can be played with a keyboard and mouse or with an Xbox controller.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm two hours in and thoroughly enjoying this game. It's hilarious. The gameplay is solid, the art design is beautiful, and the music is surprisingly high quality and fitting. The story and world keep me interested, and the puzzles are fun. However, the standout feature is the comedy. If you've played RPGs since their inception, you'll enjoy the jokes, parodies, and references. Even if you're new to RPGs, the humor is entertaining. If you've played Final Fantasy 7 or X, you must try this game. I had to pause after two hours because I was laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far!

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I'm really sorry. I try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but I really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded perfect for me, but the execution did nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but I found this one completely unintuitive. Even after looking up how to progress, I simply didn’t find the gameplay fun. It also lacks a pause button, or if it does, I never found it. Considering that many sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is more cut scene than it is game, and I end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game... Phew, where do I even begin? It was breathtaking, from the story to the graphics; I was completely captivated. The narrative wasn't just a tale; it genuinely made me feel like I was that character, trying to uncover what came next in their journey. The gameplay was outstanding, and I discovered a lot about myself, particularly my fear of heights, which was never an issue until the ice caverns. My stomach churned throughout, but I persevered for Uncle Fred! If you created a DLC or a sequel, I would be the first to purchase it and recommend it to everyone I know. Thanks to everyone involved in creating this; you made an absolutely beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth is a turn-based game where you build your civilization to achieve a specific goal or "victory." Previously, the series focused on Earth's timeline, progressing through periods like the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and Modern Age. In contrast, this game is set in the future, centered on colonizing a new planet. I enjoy how 2K adopted a fresh approach by introducing new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. However, these innovations can make the game feel overwhelming at times. I believe the game could be improved by incorporating new artwork, especially regarding the environment you experience during interactions with other leaders.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: Great game! Tons of replayability and a very fun zombie survival game! Definitely in my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: After playing 60+ hours, I can honestly say this is one of the better, more "realistic" zombie games. It's very much designed like survival horror as you must conserve ammo, treat your own wounds when bleeding out, take pills when infected, etc. Also, I find zombies to feel very natural and are well-animated for a free-to-play game. P.S.: I would recommend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends or chat with people in the chat or over voice comms.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: 02/07/2014 - It's unfortunate I can't fully recommend or enjoy this game. From the brief time I've played it, I know I'd be hooked if it weren't for these two significant issues. No Australian servers mean one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage and creates unbearable lag. Additionally, when I played the offline training mode, it was also stuttering (how does that even happen?). Coupled with poor ping, it ruins the experience. Everything, including menus, backgrounds, training, and in-game visuals, artifacts excessively. I've never had this issue before with this card and thought it might dislike my overclocking. I returned my GPU to stock settings, yet it made no difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: Late last night, I finished this. The story itself might not be very deep or intriguing, but the storytelling sets it apart. The atmosphere is immersive, and the many collectibles effectively flesh it out. I learned much about Batman's world, so it was somewhat disappointing that there were so few bosses. However, future games can address this. The combat provides a decent challenge, although leaning towards the easier side. Leveling up Batman felt unsatisfying. The gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign introduce new gameplay mechanics that are quite enjoyable. Gaining access to previously unreachable areas imparts a satisfying sense of progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: 'To the Moon' is no mere game; it is a veritable experience, and one of the best of my life at that. Think Telltale's The Walking Dead is sad? It's no match for To the Moon! Never before have I felt so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece is the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky, and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that I didn’t care. Plus, the humor of the game is great and does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story. The Doctor Who references are endless.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is a brilliant game with an exceptional storyline. Set after a calamity, you begin rebuilding on the bastion. The game offers significant choices, like what to construct for an advantage, which weapons to use, and which power-ups to apply. You can also select drinks for bonus effects. The art style and music are fantastic, with vibrant visuals that defy typical apocalyptic dullness. Best of all, the game features narration based on your actions. For instance, if you pick up a weapon then switch it in the armory, the narration will comment on you taking the new weapon.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I originally bought this game during its early development phase, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was at its best. All the guns were equally overpowered, so there were no issues with imbalance; everyone could eliminate anyone at any time. The game used to offer unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that a game boasting 'bajillions of guns' would provide more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before requiring payment for additional options. At one point, I had about 3 pages worth of guns and was planning new ideas for more, because for me, that's where the fun was.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a surprising gem. Often, rave reviews are misleading, but in this case, they truly capture the fun of this neat little game. It is an intriguing mix between a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, executed with style. I found myself enjoying characters I wouldn't typically enjoy in other MOBA games. Expecting this trait to continue, I decided to try a melee tank anyway. I was pleasantly surprised by the experience and ended up exploring more as they were unlocked from playing. The art style and interface are charmingly unique. Now, I use one of the characters as my avatar and created a wallpaper from a card set for the game.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I just started playing, but I love this game. I put on my headphones and lose myself for hours. It's been awhile since a game had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, sound effects are spot on, and controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized it extremely well. I had doubts about the naval combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets! The only way to lose is to fail to retreat. If combat looks overwhelming, just retreat, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has introduced many changes, particularly for the series' protagonist, Dante. While fans of the original series may be upset by the changes to their beloved character, it's undeniably for the better, as this new game by Ninja Theory demonstrates. DMC is an ideal entry point for newcomers to the series, showcasing the origins of an arrogant, cynical Dante and chronicling his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear narrative arc for the new Dante, making him a compelling character to follow. The story follows Dante as he's introduced to the corrupt world he previously chose to ignore.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I begin with this absolutely beautiful game? Its story is utterly charming, brimming with detail, humor, quirky dogs, and secrets. It balances seriousness with humor seamlessly. The character design is exceptional, featuring a diverse array of personalities and intriguing secrets. It stands out from other RPGs by not requiring players to kill, a unique concept in the genre. Drawing inspiration from EarthBound, one of the best RPGs I've encountered, it promises an exceptional experience. The soundtrack is truly the best I've heard in ages.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I recommend this solely because it's free, and it might offer a more enjoyable experience for others. As for my experience, the game did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked or emotionally moved. Maybe I'm desensitized, or perhaps it was too simple to elicit a reaction. The other half of the game attempts to depict a person in mental decline, dealing with obsession, hallucination, and depression. In theory, it's a cool idea. However, the game took me 10 minutes to complete, even with reading and absorbing every bit of information.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Do I even need to explain why Portal is amazing? Portal is a puzzle game that introduces a concept and then lets you engage. It's an excellent way to challenge your mind while remaining enjoyable. Although this game isn't heavily focused on story, it spawned one of the most popular games of 2011. I still play and complete it when I'm bored, appreciating what gave birth to a legend. Gameplay: Portal's gameplay is quite simple, at least in explanation. You utilize portals to your advantage, alongside buttons that activate parts of the puzzle. There are two types of buttons in the game: one you press and another requiring a cube.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you can overlook the bugs (I personally encountered only two: one minor and the other quite annoying), both of which have been resolved, I can definitely recommend this space exploration game. One fix increased my FPS from 60-90 to 80-120. Since most reviews focus on specs, I'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€), Radeon RX480 (~200€), Z170 Pro - Gaming (~150€), 16GB DDR4 RAM (~70€). This ~650€ setup is in the medium price range, albeit quite new, with almost constant 60+ FPS on high settings with Vsync enabled. I genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they have an overkill setup and get 20 FPS.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember Age of Mythology? It’s been quite some time since there’s been an RTS game of similar quality. Divinity: Dragon Commander comes impressively close to these benchmarks of my personal favorite RTS games. Coupled with a substantial, risk-like grand strategy mode, it truly hits the mark. I strive not to be overly biased, but the game’s feature allowing you to transform into a dragon—supporting, attacking, and even commanding unit production and direction simultaneously—is impressive. I genuinely appreciate complex RTS games today, like Civ V. However, these games often attempt to incorporate complex mechanics, charts, and resources into a single, intricate game mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale comes together to create something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title, and the music is captivating. Paired together, they form truly beautiful and impactful moments. The script ranges from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, while cleverly subverting RPG tropes. And this is without even delving into the world, characters, story, or gameplay... I could write pages about it. Instead, I'll just say: if you like RPGs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and the end of your life, play this game.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed The Witcher 1 and 2, The Witcher 3 is a must-have. Normally, I would rate this game 10/10, but unfortunately, after patch 1.03, it became buggy with random crashes, so remember to save often. When I played versions 1.00 to 1.03, my game never crashed, and I didn’t notice any bugs. However, after the 1.03 patch, the drawing distance sometimes becomes problematic, with objects and even people appearing only when very close. Despite these issues, the game is truly fantastic. They put a huge effort into quests—some are really emotional and deep—with lots of side quests, and your decisions significantly affect the game. I've played over 50 hours and am still engaged.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've only had this game for a few months, but in that short time, two DLCs have been released, along with patches that have transformed an already great game into an excellent one. The developers are very active in the community, which is evident in the discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a steep learning curve to the game's mechanics, which I'm still learning; however, this breadth of strategy offers myriad ways to achieve goals and take advantage of situations. In my opinion, the game is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself drawn into every session, regardless of how the playthrough is going.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is entertaining for the first few hours. Afterward, you'll notice that the game mainly offers repetition in its combat, enemies, and gameplay. The major highlight is the developers' commitment, evident in their semi-frequent updates, adding substantial content, ranging from changes to some of the game's systems to new warframes and other features. It's suitable for casual play. However, it may not captivate you for more than a few months unless you're fond of grinding. The advantage is that the game is free, so I'd recommend giving it a try. If you're seeking a quick fix, try it out.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is incredibly boring. I bought it believing it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy,' a popular and enjoyable PS2 game. Sadly, it's far from it. In this game, you absorb increasingly larger things to grow bigger and absorb even larger things. However, the gameplay lacks smoothness, the levels are not inventive, and what's present is a surreal horror show. It's not an entertaining horror show but one that leaves you rather depressed, questioning if life is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game, from small pets to humans, makes me wonder if the creators were interested in taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: Alright. Let me explain a few things. As someone very interested in politics, I was intrigued by this game when I first heard about it. I thought, "Oh wow! A simulator of the road to becoming president! That sounds fun!" Well, it really wasn't. The game starts off by requiring you to pick a side: Republican or Democrat, with no option for independent or third-party. A little disappointed but still optimistic, I continued to see what I could do. I will give the game credit: the character customization, although limited, is quite fun to experiment with. It's the only time it's an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: Fallout 3's story was superior. Settlements interfere with the storyline to the point where you'll resent managing them instead of engaging with the plot. Some keys are hardcoded and cannot be rebound. Glitches are rampant. At one point, my Pip-Boy vanished permanently, requiring research into console commands to restore it. You don’t have to earn power armor; it’s practically given from the start, with power cores abundantly available in trader shops. The value of power armor has diminished significantly from previous Fallout games. The story is mediocre, and overall, the game is unimpressive, although it doesn't crash every 10 minutes like Fallout 3, making it very stable in comparison. Is it better than Fallout 3? No. Is it better than New Vegas? No. This title was so overhyped for how disappointing it actually is.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hours to finish - 10 out of 25 collectibles found - zero out of 15 achievements attained What I liked: - Visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - The story, though not remarkable, had an ending (post-credits) that made the time spent on this game somewhat worthwhile What I disliked: - The last level's visuals are uninteresting - The gameplay in the last level becomes frustrating due to increased difficulty, requiring repeated attempts to succeed - Achievements are too challenging, with only 2.1% of players obtaining 13 out of 15!

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished:
Pros: +great graphics 

Cons: -bugs (especially in the environment; you might get stuck or your shots may hit an invisible wall despite having a clear line of sight to the enemy) -the game is overly handholding/babysitting -poor AI -enemies always seem to know your location once spotted -enemy precision is frustrating, much like the first Ghost Warrior -terrible checkpoints and saves -unengaging story that I couldn't care less about. I cannot recommend it unless it's 90% off; even then, playing this game feels more like a tedious chore, merely played for the sake of finishing it to move on to the next in my library. Considering the time wasted on the first Ghost Warrior (equally tedious, feeling liberated upon completion), I probably won't finish this one.

original: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? :d this puzzle platforming game stars a little guy with a fez who goes around collecting little bits to form a cube and navigating through a fairly large branching map. This game is quite amusing and running through it to complete the game was quite a bit of fun. ^_^ it can become semi-frustrating if you want to get all the cubes and achievements though. To get all the cubes you'll need to crack codes that you'll have to decipher. These can take a few seconds or frustrate you into looking into a guide (*raises hand* i gave up. -_-). The guide, 'a complete guide to fez!!!'
polished: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? This puzzle platforming game stars a character with a fez who collects bits to form a cube, navigating a large branching map. The game is highly entertaining, and playing through it is quite fun. However, it can be somewhat frustrating if you aim to collect all cubes and achievements. You'll need to crack codes and decipher them, which can be quick or make you consult a guide. I admittedly gave up. The guide, "A Complete Guide to Fez!!!

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: It's easy to understand why others enjoy this game, but it wasn't for me. For one, I have a Vive and prefer playing room-scale games with controllers. Additionally, the game's scale is initially awe-inspiring, yet I felt it also hindered my enjoyment. The learning curve and the time required to do anything interesting at the beginning were too steep for me. If I were more patient or had more time for gaming, this might be compelling. However, I lack both, and there are many other VR games I'd prefer to spend my time on.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: Without a doubt, my favorite first-person shooter of all time. Run-and-gun style players need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Shots to the chest, neck, or head from rifle-caliber weapons usually result in death unless they graze you. Rounds drop over distance, requiring short, controlled bursts to stay on target. There’s no magic ammo pool; reloading halfway will leave you with a pouch full of partial mags. You can't run endlessly. Sprinting for a while affects your aim as you gasp for breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a windowsill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: Let me begin by saying I did not purchase EU when it first came out; I got it on sale, which included EW, so I never experienced the issues some people claimed to have had. I loved that game; it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for XCOM 2, I love it. The game runs well for me on medium settings, and I have a GTX 560 with 2GB of VRAM. Initially, the game set itself to high, and it was running a bit sluggishly—not to the point of being unplayable, but when I lowered it to medium, it smoothed out. I'm not sure if I'm just fortunate regarding game issues, but it seems most negative reviews come from some really entitled individuals.

original: +rpg levelling +wide-variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humored -grind intensive (if under utilizing the civvy station types) -sub-par ai teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of levelling skills (that is, no branching) listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses up there, there is still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and still really picks up. Even though there's a low variety of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to increase the life of this game is the mods. polished: +RPG leveling +wide variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missiles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humor -grind intensive (if underutilizing the civilian station types) -subpar AI teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of leveling skills (that is, no branching) Listen, this game is incredibly fun. Fight for Universe is easily the standout, but Big Fight for Beef is also excellent.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: World leaders gather to face uncertainty as more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe arrive in the Swiss mountain resort of Davos for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from China's economic power to Iraq's future after this Sunday's elections. UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders attending. Unlike in previous years, protests against the WEF are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the rival World Social Forum, timed to coincide with the WEF's more opulent event in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished:
Deadline Approaches for Fiat-GM Deal

Fiat and General Motors (GM) face a midnight deadline on 1 February to resolve their disagreement over a potential takeover. This marks the point when Fiat gains the right to sell its car division to GM, as part of a 2000 alliance. GM, whose European operations are unprofitable, is unwilling to acquire the struggling Fiat unit. Talks at an impasse led to a 1.2% drop in Fiat shares on Tuesday, following a 4% rise on Monday due to payoff hopes. The U.S. firm reportedly offers $2bn (£1.06bn) to exit the deal, asserting that Fiat's decision to sell its finance arm and halve GM's stake rendered the agreement void. The 2000 deal emerged from a competition between GM and DaimlerChrysler to partner with Fiat.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease". The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make history poverty".
polished: Cardinal criticizes Iraq war: billions of pounds spent on conflict in Iraq and the Middle East should have been used to reduce poverty, Cardinal Cormac Murphy-O'Connor has said. The head of the Catholic Church in England and Wales made the comments on BBC Radio 4 and will reiterate his stance in his Christmas Midnight Mass. The cardinal used a Christmas message to denounce the war in Iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the Archbishop of Canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on BBC Radio 4's Thought for the Day slot, he criticized the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease." The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make poverty history.

original: British stars denied major oscars british hopes of winning major oscars were dashed as uk stars failed to win acting and directing prizes. Despite three nominations, mike leigh's vera drake failed to take the director or screenplay awards and there was no prize for star imelda staunton. Kate winslet also lost to best actress hilary swank, while clive owen and sophie okonedo failed to win best supporting actor awards. The uk's andrea arnold won the short film award for her gritty drama wasp. Arnold, who presented children's television shows number 73 and motormouth in the 1980s, said it was "totally overwhelming" to win. Wasp tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, beating films by fellow uk nominees gary mckendry and ashvin kumar.
polished: British stars were denied major Oscars as UK celebrities failed to win acting and directing prizes. Despite three nominations, Mike Leigh's "Vera Drake" did not win the director or screenplay awards, and no prize was awarded to star Imelda Staunton. Kate Winslet also lost Best Actress to Hilary Swank, while Clive Owen and Sophie Okonedo failed to secure Best Supporting Actor awards. However, the UK's Andrea Arnold won the Short Film award for her gritty drama "Wasp." Arnold, who presented children's television shows "Number 73" and "Motormouth" in the 1980s, said it was "totally overwhelming" to win. "Wasp" tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, surpassing films by fellow UK nominees Gary McKendry and Ashvin Kumar.

original: Halloween writer debra hill dies screenwriter and producer debra hill, best known for her work on the 70s horror classic halloween, has died in los angeles aged 54. Hill, who had been suffering from cancer, co-wrote the 1978 film, which starred jamie lee curtis as a babysitter terrorised by a psychopath. Directed by john carpenter, it made over $60m (£31.3m) worldwide - a record for independent film at that time. Hill also worked with carpenter on escape from new york and the fog. Born in new jersey, hill began her career as a production assistant and worked her way through the ranks, becoming an assistant director and second-unit director before she began collaborating with carpenter. She was regarded by many as a pioneering woman in film, taking on jobs in the 70s that were more commonly taken by men.
polished: Debra Hill, a screenwriter and producer best known for her work on the '70s horror classic "Halloween," has passed away in Los Angeles at the age of 54. Hill, who had been battling cancer, co-wrote the 1978 film featuring Jamie Lee Curtis as a babysitter terrorized by a psychopath. Directed by John Carpenter, it earned over $60 million (£31.3 million) worldwide—a record for independent film at that time. Hill collaborated with Carpenter on "Escape from New York" and "The Fog." Born in New Jersey, she started as a production assistant, advancing to become an assistant director and second-unit director before teaming up with Carpenter. She was seen by many as a trailblazer for women in film, taking jobs in the '70s traditionally held by men.

original: Broadband fuels online expression fast web access is encouraging more people to express themselves online, research suggests. A quarter of broadband users in britain regularly upload content and have personal sites, according to a report by uk think-tank demos. It said that having an always-on, fast connection is changing the way people use the internet. More than five million households in the uk have broadband and that number is growing fast. The demos report looked at the impact of broadband on people's net habits. It found that more than half of those with broadband logged on to the web before breakfast. One in five even admitted to getting up in the middle of the night to browse the web. More significantly, argues the report, broadband is encouraging people to take a more active role online.
polished: Broadband fuels online expression. Fast web access is encouraging more people to express themselves online, research suggests. A quarter of broadband users in Britain regularly upload content and maintain personal sites, according to a report by UK think-tank Demos. It stated that having an always-on, fast connection is changing the way people use the internet. More than five million households in the UK have broadband, and that number is rapidly increasing. The Demos report examined the impact of broadband on people's net habits. It found that more than half of those with broadband logged onto the web before breakfast. One in five even admitted to getting up in the middle of the night to browse. More significantly, the report argues, broadband is motivating people to take a more active role online.

original: Yukos heading back to us courts russian oil and gas company yukos is due in a us court on thursday as it continues to fight for its survival. The firm is in the process of being broken up by russian authorities in order to pay a $27bn (£14bn) tax bill. Yukos filed for bankruptcy in the us, hoping to use international business law to halt the forced sale of its key oil production unit, yuganskneftegas. The unit was however sold for $9.4bn to state oil firm rosneft but only after the state auction had been disrupted. Yukos lawyers now say the auction violated us bankruptcy law. The company and its main shareholders have vowed to go after any company that buys its assets, using all and every legal means.
polished: Yukos is heading back to U.S. courts. The Russian oil and gas company is due in a U.S. court on Thursday as it continues to fight for its survival. The firm is being broken up by Russian authorities to address a $27bn (£14bn) tax bill. Yukos filed for bankruptcy in the U.S., hoping international business law will prevent the forced sale of its key oil production unit, Yuganskneftegas. The unit was sold for $9.4bn to Rosneft after the state auction was disrupted. Yukos lawyers now argue that the auction violated U.S. bankruptcy law. The company and its main shareholders have vowed to pursue any buyer of its assets through legal means.

original: Voters flock to blog awards site voting is under way for the annual bloggies which recognise the best web blogs - online spaces where people publish their thoughts - of the year. Nominations were announced on sunday, but traffic to the official site was so heavy that the website was temporarily closed because of too many visitors. Weblogs have been nominated in 30 categories, from the top regional blog, to the best-kept-secret blog. Blogs had a huge year, with a top us dictionary naming "blog" word of 2004. Technorati, a blog search engine, tracks about six million blogs and says that more than 12,000 are added daily. A blog is created every 5.8 seconds, according to us research think-tank pew internet and american life, but less than 40% of the total are updated at least once every two months.
polished: Voters are flocking to the blog awards site now that voting is underway for the annual Bloggies, which recognize the year's best web blogs—online spaces where people publish their thoughts. Technorati, a blog search engine, tracks about six million blogs and reports that more than 12,000 are added daily. According to the U.S. research think-tank Pew Internet and American Life, a new blog is created every 5.8 seconds, though less than 40% are updated at least once every two months.

original: Chinese dam firm 'defies beijing' the china three gorges project corp is refusing to obey a government order to stop construction of one of its giant dams, the chinese state press has said. The builder of the three gorges dam is continuing work on the sister xiluodu dam, said the beijing news. The xiluodu dam is one of 30 such large-scale construction projects called to a halt because of a lack of proper environmental checks. The beijing news said the company may instead choose to pay a fine. The firm has also ignored orders to stop construction at two of its other projects - the three gorges underground power plant and the three gorges project electrical power supply plant. So far, only 22 of the 30 construction projects targeted by china's state environmental protection agency (sepa) for having not carried out mandatory environmental impact assessments have complied with its shutdown order.
polished: The Chinese Three Gorges Project Corp is reportedly defying a government order to cease construction on one of its massive dams, according to state media. Despite directives to halt work on the Xiluodu Dam due to insufficient environmental evaluations, the builder of the Three Gorges Dam continues its activities, as reported by the Beijing News. The company might opt to pay a penalty instead of complying. It has also ignored orders to pause construction on two other projects: the Three Gorges Underground Power Plant and the Three Gorges Project Electrical Power Supply Plant. To date, only 22 of the 30 construction projects targeted by the State Environmental Protection Agency (SEPA) have adhered to the shutdown order due to a lack of required environmental impact assessments.

original: Man city 0-2 man utd manchester united reduced chelsea's premiership lead to nine points after a scrappy victory over manchester city. Wayne rooney met gary neville's cross to the near post with a low shot, which went in via a deflection off richard dunne, to put united ahead. Seven minutes later, the unfortunate dunne hooked a volley over david james' head and into his own net. Steve mcmanaman wasted city's best chance when he shot wide from three yards in the first half. In the opening 45 minutes united had looked unlikely to earn the win they needed to maintain any chance of catching chelsea in the title race. Their approach play was more laboured than patient and they managed to fashion just one chance - a paul scholes header over the bar.
polished: Manchester United reduced Chelsea's Premiership lead to nine points with a scrappy 2-0 victory over Manchester City. Wayne Rooney connected with Gary Neville's cross to the near post with a low shot, which deflected off Richard Dunne, giving United the lead. Seven minutes later, Dunne unfortunately sent a volley over David James' head into his own net. Steve McManaman wasted City's best chance, shooting wide from three yards in the first half. In the opening 45 minutes, United seemed unlikely to secure the win they needed to chase Chelsea in the title race. Their approach play appeared more labored than patient, with only one chance in the form of a Paul Scholes header over the bar.

original: Wales 'must learn health lessons' the new health minister for wales says there are lessons to learn from england in tackling waiting lists. Dr brian gibbons, on his first full day in the job after jane hutt was sacked, admitted "big challenges" but insisted the "essentials" were in place. But both plaid cymru and the liberal democrats said dr gibbons needed to change policy. Meanwhile ms hutt defended her record, saying waiting times and lists were "only 10% of the health agenda. Dr gibbons, who was a gp in blaengwynfi, in the upper afan valley, before becoming am for aberavon, said nhs staff wanted a period of consolidation after "tremendous change and reform". One of the biggest problems which had faced ms hutt during her five-and-a-half years as the assembly's first health minister was the length of waiting lists in wales.
polished: Wales 'must learn health lessons,' the new health minister for Wales says, indicating there are lessons to learn from England in tackling waiting lists. However, both Plaid Cymru and the Liberal Democrats asserted Dr. Gibbons needed to change policy. One of the biggest issues Ms. Hutt faced during her tenure was the length of waiting lists in Wales.

original: Ferguson hails man utd's resolve manchester united's alex ferguson has praised his players' gutsy performance in the 1-0 win at aston villa. "that was our hardest away game of the season and it was a fantastic game of football, end-to-end with lots of good passing," said the old trafford boss. "we showed lots of character and guts and we weren't going to lose. "i look at that fixture and think we've been there and won, while arsenal and chelsea have yet to come and villa may have some players back when they do." ferguson also hailed senior stars ryan giggs and roy keane, who came off the bench for the injured john o'shea. "roy came on and brought a bit of composure to the midfield which we needed and which no other player has got.

"We showed lots of character and determination; we weren't going to lose. I look at that fixture and think we've been there and won, while Arsenal and Chelsea have yet to come. Villa may have some players back when they do." Ferguson also praised senior stars Ryan Giggs and Roy Keane, who came off the bench for the injured John O'Shea. "Roy brought composure to the midfield, which we needed and no other player has got.

original: Singer's film to show at festival a documentary which takes a candid look at the life of chart-topping singer george michael will be shown at this year's berlin film festival. A different story will screen in the panorama section of the festival, which runs from 10-20 february. It features the singer talking about both his career and his personal life, from his days in wham! through to more recent events. Michael will attend the festival to introduce the screening on 16 february. Director southan morris and executive producer andy stephens will also attend the festival. The 93 minute film will see michael discussing his early days in wham! along with his later career, including his legal battles with record label sony and his stance against the iraq war and american politics.
polished: A documentary offering an intimate glimpse into the life of chart-topping singer George Michael will be showcased at this year's Berlin Film Festival. "A Different Story" is set to screen in the Panorama section of the festival, which runs from 10-20 February. It features the singer discussing both his career and personal life, from his days in Wham! to more recent events. Michael will attend the festival to introduce the screening on 16 February. Director Southan Morris and executive producer Andy Stephens will also be present. The 93-minute film will see Michael exploring his early days in Wham! along with his later career, including his legal battles with record label Sony and his stance against the Iraq War and American politics.

original: Downloads enter us singles chart digital music downloads are being included in the main us singles chart for the first time. Billboard's hot 100 chart now incorporates data from sales of music downloads, previously only assigned to a separate download chart. Green day's boulevard of broken dreams is currently number two in billboard's pop chart, and tops its digital chart. Download sales are due to be incorporated into the uk singles chart later this year. Digital sales in the us are already used to compile billboard's hot digital sales chart. They will now be tallied with sales of physical singles and airplay information to make up its new hot 100 chart. Its second new chart - the pop 100 - also combines airplay, digital and physical sales but confines its airplay information to us radio stations which play chart music.
polished: Downloads have now entered the US singles chart as digital music downloads are being included for the first time. Billboard's Hot 100 chart now incorporates data from music download sales, which were previously assigned to a separate download chart. Green Day's "Boulevard of Broken Dreams" is currently number two on Billboard's pop chart and tops its digital chart. Download sales are due to be included in the UK singles chart later this year. Digital sales in the US already contribute to Billboard's Hot Digital Sales chart. They will now be combined with physical singles sales and airplay data to form the new Hot 100 chart. The second new chart, the Pop 100, also combines airplay and digital and physical sales but confines its airplay information to US radio stations that play chart music.

original: Anti-spam laws bite spammer hard the net's self-declared spam king is seeking bankruptcy protection. Scott richter, the man behind optinrealbig.com and billions of junk mail messages, said lawsuits had forced the company into chapter 11. Optinrealbig was fighting several legal battles, most notably against microsoft, which is pushing for millions of dollars in damages. The company said filing for chapter 11 would help it try to resolve its legal problems but still keep trading. Listed as the third biggest spammer in the world by junk mail watchdog spamhaus, optinrealbig was sued in december 2003 for sending mail messages that violated anti-spam laws. The lawsuit was brought by microsoft and new york attorney general eliot spitzer who alleged that mr richter and his accomplices sent billions of spam messages through 514 compromised net addresses in 35 countries.
polished: Anti-spam laws have hit a self-proclaimed "spam king" hard, as he is now seeking bankruptcy protection. The company is battling several legal issues, notably against Microsoft, which seeks millions in damages. Filing for Chapter 11 aims to help resolve these legal problems while keeping operations running. Ranked as the third largest spammer globally by Spamhaus, OptInRealBig was sued in December 2003 for violating anti-spam laws. This lawsuit was initiated by Microsoft and New York Attorney General Eliot Spitzer, who accused Richter and his associates of sending billions of spam messages through 514 compromised network addresses across 35 countries.

original: Arnesen denies rift with santini tottenham sporting director frank arnesen has denied that coach jacques santini resigned because of a clash of personalities at white hart lane. There had been newspaper speculation that santini had felt undermined by arnesen's role at the club. "it is absolutely not true," arnesen told bbc radio five live. "there is only one thing that made him resign and that is his own personal problems. "he has talked to me recently and said this matter is absolutely for himself." arnesen said he was unable to throw any light onto the problems that caused santini to quit after just 13 games in charge. He added: "jacques has never gone into exactly what it was. But i trust him in that; you have to accept it. I think we should respect it.

original: Ireland surge past scots ireland maintained their six nations grand slam ambitions with an impressive victory over scotland at murrayfield. Hugo southwell's try gave the scots an early 8-0 lead but scores from locks malcolm o'kelly and paul o'connell put the visitors in command by half-time. A third try from wing denis hickie and third penalty from ronan o'gara, who kicked 13 points, extended the lead. Jon petrie scored a second try for scotland but late scores from john hayes and gavin duffy sealed victory. After two hard-earned away victories, eddie o'sullivan' side can now look forward to welcoming england to lansdowne road in a fortnight. Scotland will try to give their coach matt williams a first six nations victory when italy come to edinburgh, but they again struggled to turn pressure into points.
polished: Ireland surged past Scotland, maintaining their Six Nations Grand Slam ambitions with an impressive victory at Murrayfield. A third try from wing Denis Hickie and a third penalty from Ronan O'Gara, who kicked 13 points, extended the lead. Jon Petrie scored a second try for Scotland, but late scores from John Hayes and Gavin Duffy sealed victory. After two hard-earned away victories, Eddie O'Sullivan's side can now look forward to welcoming England to Lansdowne Road in a fortnight. Scotland will endeavor to give their coach, Matt Williams, a first Six Nations victory when Italy comes to Edinburgh but they again struggled to turn pressure into points.

original: Economy focus for election battle britain's economic future will be at the heart of labour's poll campaign, chancellor gordon brown has said. He was speaking after cabinet members held their last meeting at no 10 before the expected election announcement. He said voters would recognise that labour had brought stability and growth, and would continue to do so. Meanwhile the tories outlined their plans to tackle "yob culture" and the lib dems gave more details about their proposals to replace council tax. Earlier the archbishop of canterbury wrote to all three parties urging them not to fight the election by exploiting people's fears. In an open letter, he called on them not to turn the election into a competition about who can most effectively frighten voters about terrorism, asylum, and crime.
polished: The focus of the election battle will be Britain's economic future, according to Chancellor Gordon Brown, who stated this would be at the heart of Labour's campaign. After the cabinet's final meeting at No. 10 before the anticipated election announcement, he expressed confidence that voters would acknowledge Labour's role in providing stability and growth, pledging to continue this trajectory. Meanwhile, the Tories presented their strategies to address "yob culture," and the Lib Dems shared further details on their plans to replace council tax. Earlier, the Archbishop of Canterbury wrote to all three parties, urging them not to exploit people's fears during the election. In his open letter, he cautioned against turning the election into a contest of who can most effectively incite fear about terrorism, asylum, and crime.

original: Brizzel to run aaa's in sheffield ballymena sprinter paul brizzel will be among eight of ireland's european indoor hopefuls competing in this weekend's aaa's championships. Us-based alistair cragg and mark carroll are the only irish athletes selected so far for the europeans who will not run in sheffield. Brizzel will defend his 200m title in the british trials. In-form james mcilroy will hope to confirm his place in the british team for madrid by winning the 800m title. Mcilroy has been in tremendous form on the european circuit in recent weeks. He is one of the fastest 800m runners in the world this winter and already seems assured of a place in madrid. Corkman mark carroll confirmed in midweek that he would join cragg in the european championships. Carroll is ranked number three in the world 3000m ranking at the moment with cragg occupying top spot.
polished: Brizzel to Compete in AAA's in Sheffield Ballymena sprinter Paul Brizzel will be among eight of Ireland's European indoor hopefuls participating in this weekend's AAA's championships. U.S.-based Alistair Cragg and Mark Carroll are the only Irish athletes selected so far for the Europeans who will not compete in Sheffield. Brizzel will defend his 200m title in the British trials. In-form James McIlroy aims to secure his spot in the British team for Madrid by winning the 800m title. McIlroy has been in tremendous form on the European circuit in recent weeks. He is one of the fastest 800m runners in the world this winter and seems assured of a place in Madrid. Corkman Mark Carroll confirmed midweek that he would join Cragg in the European championships. Carroll is currently ranked number three in the world 3000m ranking, with Cragg holding the top spot.

original: Robinson wants dual code success england rugby union captain jason robinson has targeted dual code success over australia on saturday. Robinson, a former rugby league international before switching codes in 2000, leads england against australia at twickenham at 1430 gmt. And at 1815 gmt, great britain's rugby league team take on australia in the final of the tri-nations tournament. "beating the aussies in both games would be a massive achievement, especially for league," said robinson. England have the chance to seal their third autumn international victory after successive wins over canada and south africa, as well as gaining revenge for june's 51-15 hammering by the wallabies. Meanwhile, great britain could end 34 years of failure against australia with victory at elland road.

original: Warning over tsunami aid website net users are being told to avoid a scam website that claims to collect cash on behalf of tsunami victims. The site looks plausible because it uses an old version of the official disasters emergency committee webpage. However, dec has no connection with the fake site and says it has contacted the police about it. The site is just the latest in a long list of scams that try to cash in on the goodwill generated by the tsunami disaster. The link to the website is contained in a spam e-mail that is currently circulating. The message's subject line reads "urgent tsunami earthquake appeal" and its text bears all the poor grammar and bad spelling that characterises many other phishing attempts.
